title: Two men are rushed to hospital after a double stabbing in broad daylight in north London
text:
Two men have been rushed to hospital after a double stabbing in a broad daylight in north London.

Officers were called to West Green Road, in Tottenham, at 9.35am today, and found two men stabbed, and a third man who had been assaulted.

Both the men have been taken to hospital for treatment. There is no update on their current condition.

A Metropolitan Police spokesman said: 'No arrests have been made. Enquiries continue. A crime scene remains in place.'

Officers were called to West Green Road, in Tottenham, at 9.35am today, and found two men stabbed, and a third assaulted

It comes a day after two more stabbing incidents in Lawless London, including a man in his early 20s receiving multiple stab wounds at Westfield Shopping Centre, in Shepherd's Bush.

The victim was treated by paramedics before being taken to a west London hospital. Metropolitan police confirmed his injuries are non-life threatening.

Just hours prior a man was left fighting for his life after being stabbed in east London.

Officers were called to Turner Street in Whitechapel at 2.05pm to reports of men fighting.

One man was found with stab wounds and was taken to hospital in a critical condition, the Met police said.

Two men were arrested at the scene on suspicion of attempted murder and have been taken into custody.
description: Met Police were called to West Green Road, in Tottenham, at 9.35am today, and found two men stabbed, and a third man who had been assaulted.
